means: [人名] [英格兰人姓氏] 迈纳斯取自父名，来源于Miner,含义是“迈纳之子”(son of Miner)

sentence.Network_en: Friends passed the word that the miners wanted to see him.
sentence.Network_cn: 朋友们传话说矿工们想见他。

sentence.Network_en: The miners ended their year-long strike in March 1985.
sentence.Network_cn: 1985年3月矿工们结束了持续一年之久的罢工。

sentence.Network_en: Miners have been thrown on the scrapheap with no prospects.
sentence.Network_cn: 大批矿工被解雇，工作没着落。

PerfectNetExp.abs: twenty miners were trapped underground after the gas explosion ., 瓦斯爆炸后有二十名矿工被困井下.
The miners are asking for another increase in pay ., 煤矿工人正在要求再次加薪.
As commodity prices rebound , miners and bankers forecast a reverse in that trend ., 随着大宗商品价格反弹 , 矿商和银行家们预计 , 上述趋势将出现逆转.

at a mine in Utah , rescuers may have missed their mark while drilling to reach six trapped miners . the drill may have hit a sealed shaft , away from the miners .在犹他州的一个矿井，救援人员在钻井营救六名被困矿工时怀疑钻偏，钻孔机打到了一个远离被困矿工的密封的轴上。

entry.def: A miner is a person who works underground in mines in order to obtain minerals such as coal, diamonds, or gold.

auth_sentence.content: In the end the miners went back to work.
auth_sentence.res_content: In the end the miners went back to work.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: In the end the miners went back to work.

auth_sentence.content: But local gold miners are worried about the future.
